function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Contagion-related behaviours like breathing, sneezing, and coughing can lead to the spread of air-based contagions in the built environment.","Impact":"Increased risk of airborne transmission of contagious diseases","Mitigation":"Implement ventilation systems to improve air circulation and filtration, and enforce the use of face masks in indoor spaces.","Technologies":"Ventilation systems with HEPA filters, UV-C air purifiers, and air quality sensors.","People":"Building occupants, especially those in crowded or poorly ventilated indoor spaces","Owner":"Building managers, public health authorities"},{"Description":"Surface-based contagions from behaviors like surface-touching and hand-sanitizing may lead to the spread of contagious diseases through contact with contaminated surfaces.","Impact":"Increased risk of surface-based transmission of contagious diseases","Mitigation":"Promote regular hand washing, use of hand sanitizers, and implement frequent cleaning and disinfection of high-touch surfaces.","Technologies":"Touchless fixtures, antimicrobial surfaces, UV-C surface sterilizers, and scheduling regular cleaning protocols.","People":"Building occupants, especially those in shared or high-traffic spaces","Owner":"Building managers, facilities management teams"},{"Description":"Simulating virus-human-building interactions can lead to a better understanding of how contagious diseases spread in built environments, but may also present privacy and ethical concerns related to data collection and monitoring.","Impact":"Potential privacy violations and ethical dilemmas related to data collection and monitoring","Mitigation":"Implement transparent data collection and privacy policies, obtain informed consent, and anonymize data to protect individual privacy.","Technologies":"Privacy-preserving data collection methods, encryption techniques, and data anonymization tools.","People":"Building occupants, researchers, data analysts, and privacy advocates","Owner":"Building managers, researchers, and privacy compliance officers"}]}
